title: Game-Based Learning for Engineering Mathematics: Short-Intensive Course for Working Professionals

context.prior_knowledge: Experience solving high school-level foundational math and engineering problems
context.additional_context: Practical engineering mathematics education for professionals, emphasizing intuitive understanding and application of complex concepts through game-based learning

learning_goals: Learners solve engineering problems with over 80% accuracy by applying differential equations and linear algebra concepts to game scenarios.
Learners apply mathematical principles to real-world engineering situations (e.g., circuit design, structural analysis) using simulation tools provided in the game.
Learners evaluate collaborative problem-solving skills through team-based game projects and achieve over 90% participation in final projects.

resources: Real-Time Collaboration Tools (e.g., Miro, Google Jamboard)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
